Table1.News title: Vaccinations opening for all Californians aged 50 and up April 1st, and 16 and up April 15th
Table1.News content: The state is expanding who is eligible to get the vaccine based on expected supply increases. It will still take months to get every Californian vaccinated who wants to be, but millions are being vaccinated each week.

Table1.News title: COVID-19 vaccinations in California reach 15 million
Table1.News content: The total number of COVID-19 vaccinations administered in California has reached 15 million. See vaccination statistics statewide and broken down by county in our Vaccine Dashboard.

Table1.News title: Californians at higher risk from COVID-19 are eligible for vaccination now
Table1.News content: If you have a medical condition or disability that increases your risk of getting sick with COVID-19, or live or work in high-risk settings, you can get vaccinated now. Find out how to see if youâ€™re eligible and make an appointment.
